title: Content.js refactoring patterns
details:
Refactored content.js from CodeScene score 8.55 to 9.09 using these patterns:

1. Extract complex conditionals into named boolean helper functions
2. Use wrapper functions to reduce duplication in similar handlers
3. Use dispatcher pattern (ACTION_HANDLERS/TYPE_HANDLERS maps) to replace large if-chain
4. Extract logging arguments into helper functions to reduce cc from optional chaining operators
5. Generic handler wrappers (_wrapSyncTestHandler, _wrapAsyncTestHandler) reduce boilerplate in test bridge handlers

Trade-off: Extracting functions reduces cyclomatic complexity but increases function count, which can trigger "Brain Class" warnings. Balance is needed.
